title: Common English Vocabulary Words that Start with B

json.text: Welcome to PnT English channel, a learning English vocabulary with videos channel.
Welcome to the Oxford 3000 essential words program. Now, let's start learning English.
Section 2: Letter B. baby. b . a . b . y . baby. baby means a very
young child who has not yet begun to walk or talk. Isn't she too young to have a baby?
back. b . a . c . k . back. back means the posterior part of a human or animal body from
the neck to the end of the spine. His back was nicely tanned.
background. b . a . c . k . g . r . o . u . n . d . background. background means the
part of a scene (or picture) that lies behind objects in the foreground. He posed her against
a background of rolling hills. backward. b . a . c . k . w . a . r . d . backward.
backward means at or to or toward the back or rear. She looked backward out the window
of the car. backward. b . a . c . k . w . a . r . d . backward.
backward means directed or facing toward the back or rear. A backward view.
bacteria. b . a . c . t . e . r . i . a . bacteria. bacteria means single-celled or non-cellular
spherical or spiral or rod-shaped organisms lacking chlorophyll that reproduce by fission;
important as pathogens and for biochemical properties; taxonomy is difficult; often considered
plants. Chlorine is added to kill bacteria. bad. b . a . d . bad. bad means having undesirable
or negative qualities. His sloppy appearance made a bad impression.
go bad. go bad. go bad means stop operating or functioning. The bus we travelled in go
bad on the way to town. badly. b . a . d . l . y . badly. badly means
to a severe or serious degree. Fingers so badly frozen they had to be amputated.
bag. b . a . g . bag. bag means a flexible container with a single opening. He stuffed
his laundry into a large bag. baggage. b . a . g . g . a . g . e . baggage.
baggage meansa case used to carry belongings when traveling. Check your baggage in at the
desk. bake. b . a . k . e . . . . . . . . . . . . bake.
bake means cook and make edible by putting in a hot oven. Bake the potatoes.
balance b . a . l . a . n . c . e . balance. balance means a situation in which different
things exist in equal. bring into balance or equilibrium. Try to
keep a balance between work and relaxation. She has to balance work and her domestic duties.
ball b . a . l . l . ball. ball means round object that is hit or thrown or kicked in
games. The ball travelled 90 mph on his serve. ban b . a . n . . ban. ban means a decree
that prohibits something. Prohibit especially by legal means or social pressure. Smoking
is banned in this building. band b . a . n . d . band. band means an unofficial
association of people or groups. He is a rock singer with a band.
bandage b . a . n . d . a . g . e . bandage. bandage meansÂ a piece of soft material that
covers and protects an injured part of the body. Wrap around with something so as to
cover or enclose. The nurse bandaged a sprained ankle.
bank b . a . n . k . bank. bank means a financial institution that accepts deposits and channels
the money into lending activities. That bank holds the mortgage on my home.
bar b . a . r . bar. bar means a room or establishment where alcoholic drinks are served over a counter.
He drowned his sorrows in whiskey at the bar. barely b . a . r . e . l . y . barely. barely
means in a sparse or scanty way. A barely furnished room.
bargain b . a . r . g . a . i . n . bargain. bargain means an agreement between parties
(usually arrived at after discussion) fixing obligations of each. He made a bargain with
the devil. barrier b . a . r . r . i . e . r . barrier.
barrier means any condition that makes it difficult to make progress or to achieve an
objective. Intolerance is a barrier to understanding. base b . a . s . e . base. base means lowest
support of a structure. use as a basis for; found on. It was built on a base of solid
rock. Base a claim on some observation. based b . a . s . e . d . based. based means
being founded on. Criticisms based on ignorance. baseball b . a . s . e . b . a . l . l . baseball.
baseball means a ball game played with a bat and ball between two teams of nine players;
teams take turns at bat trying to score runs. There was a baseball game on every empty lot.
basic b . a . s . i . c . basic. basic means pertaining to or constituting a base or basis.
Basic changes in public opinion occur because of changes in priorities.
basically b . a . s . i . c . a . l . l . y . basically. basically means at bottom or
by one's (or its) very nature. He is basically dishonest.
basis b . a . s . i . s . basis. basis means a relation that provides the foundation for
something. He worked on an interim basis. basketball b . a . s . k . e . t . b . a . l
. l . basketball. basketball means a game played on a court by two opposing teams of
5 players. He is a famous basketball player. bath b . a . t . h . bath. bath means you
soak and wash your body in a bathtub. He has a good bath every morning.
bathroom b . a . t . h . r . o . o . m . bathroom. bathroom means a room (as in a residence)
containing a bathtub or shower and usually a washbasin and toilet. His house has a large
bathroom. battery b . a . t . t . e . r . y . battery.
battery means a device that produces electricity; may have several primary or secondary cells
arranged in parallel or series. My phone has a low battery.
battle b . a . t . t . l . e . battle. battle means a hostile meeting of opposing military
forces in the course of a war. He lost his romantic ideas about war when he got into
a real battle. bay b . a . y . bay. bay means a part of the
sea, or of a large lake, enclosed by a wide curve of the shore. The Bay of Bengal.
be b . e . be. be means have the quality of being when used with an adjective or a predicate
noun. be identical to; be someone or something. The president of the company is John Smith.
beach b . e . a . c . h . beach. beach means an area of sand sloping down to the water
of a sea or lake. Tourists sunbathing on the beach.
beak b . e . a . k . beak. beak means beaklike mouth of animals other than birds. A black
bird with a yellow beak. bear b . e . a . r . bear. bear means put
up with something or somebody unpleasant. I cannot bear his constant criticism.
beard b . e . a . r . d . beard. beard means the hair growing on the lower part of a man's
face. He has a nice beard. beat b . e . a . t . beat. beat means the
rhythmic contraction and expansion of the arteries with each beat of the heart. come
out better in a competition, race, or conflict. He could feel the beat of her heart. Agassi
beat Becker in the tennis championship. beautiful b . e . a . u . t . i . f . u . l
. beautiful. beautiful means delighting the senses or exciting intellectual or emotional
admiration. A beautiful child. beautifully b . e . a . u . t . i . f . u
. l . l . y . beautifully. beautifully meansÂ in a beautiful manner. Her face was beautifully
made up. beauty b . e . a . u . t . y . beauty. beauty
means the qualities that give pleasure to the senses. His roses were beauties.
because b . e . c . a . u . s . e . because. because means for the reason that. I did it
because he told me to. because of because of. because of means on
account of. I lost my job because of her. become b . e . c . o . m . e . become. become
means enter or assume a certain state or condition. He became annoyed when he heard the bad news.
bed b . e . d . bed. bed means a piece of furniture that provides a place to sleep.
He sat on the edge of the bed. bedroom b . e . d . r . o . o . m . bedroom.
bedroom means a room used primarily for sleeping. The master bedroom in a large house is the
largest bedroom. beef b . e . e . f . beef. beef means cattle
that are reared for their meat. Farm has both beef and dairy cattle.
beer b . e . e . r . beer. beer means a general name for alcoholic beverages made by fermenting
a cereal flavored with hops. He buys a root beer.
before b . e . f . o . r . e . before. before means earlier in time. He called me the day
before but your call had come even earlier. begin b . e . g . i . n . begin. begin means
take the first step or steps in carrying out an action. The first tourists began to arrive
in Cambodia. beginning b . e . g . i . n . n . i . n . g
. beginning. beginning means the event consisting of the start of something. The beginning of
the war. behalf b . e . h . a . l . f . behalf. behalf
means for someone's benefit. Campaigning in his own behalf.
behave b . e . h . a . v . e . behave. behave means show a certain behavior. Don't behave
like a fool. behavior b . e . h . a . v . i . o . r . behavior.
behavior means manner of acting or controlling yourself. The behavior of small particles
can be studied in experiments. behind b . e . h . i . n . d . behind. behind
means in or to or toward the rear. Seen from behind, the house is more imposing than it
is from the front. belief b . e . l . i . e . f . belief. belief
means a vague idea in which some confidence is placed. It strengthened my belief in his
sincerity. believe b . e . l . i . e . v . e . believe.
believe means accept as true. We didn't believe his stories from the War.
bell b . e . l . l . bell. bell means a hollow device made of metal that makes a ringing
sound when struck. She heard the distant toll of church bells.
belong b . e . l . o . n . g . belong. belong means be owned by. This book belongs to me.
below b . e . l . o . w . below. below means in or to a place that is lower. Please do
not write below this line belt b . e . l . t . belt. belt means a band
to tie or buckle around the body. A belt buckle. bend b . e . n . d . bend. bend means form
a curve. A circular segment of a curve. The stick does not bend. A bend in the road.
bent b . e . n . t . bent. bent means altered from an originally straight condition. A bent
wire. beneath b . e . n . e . a . t . h . beneath.
beneath means in or to a place that is lower. They found the body buried beneath a pile
of leaves. benefit b . e . n . e . f . i . t . benefit.
benefit means financial assistance in time of need. Derive a benefit from. She benefited
ed from his vast experience. beside b . e . s . i . d . e . beside. beside
means next to or at the side of someone or something. He sat beside her all night.
bet b . e . t . bet. bet means maintain with or as if with a bet. The money risked on a
gamble. I bet she will be there! he did it on a bet.
better b . e . t . t . e . r . better. better means superior to another. You're a better
man than I am, Gunga Din. between b . e . t . w . e . e . n . between.
between means in the interval. Dancing all the dances with little rest between.
beyond b . e . y . o . n . d . beyond. beyond means farther along in space or time or degree.
To the eighth grade but not beyond. bicycle b . i . c . y . c . l . e . bicycle.
bicycle means a wheeled vehicle that has two wheels and is moved by foot pedals. We went
for a bicycle ride on Sunday. bid b . i . d . bid. bid means propose a payment.
An authoritative direction or instruction to do something. The prophet bid all people
to become good persons. He made a bid to gain attention.
big b . i . g . big. big means above average in size or number or quantity or magnitude
or extent. Set out for the big city. bill b . i . l . l . bill. bill means an itemized
statement of money owed for goods shipped or services rendered. He paid his bill and
left. biology b . i . o . l . o . g . y . biology.
biology means the science that studies living organisms. The biology of viruses.
bird b . i . r . d . bird. bird means warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrates characterized by feathers
and forelimbs modified as wings. A bird's nest with two eggs in it .
birth b . i . r . t . h . birth. birth means the time when something begins. They divorced
after the birth of the child. give birth give birth. give birth means cause
to be born. Female killer whales stop givingÂ birthÂ at approximately 40 years of age.
birthday b . i . r . t . h . d . a . y . birthday. birthday means an anniversary of the day on
which a person was born. She celebrated her 24th birthday .
bit b . i . t . bit. bit means a small quantity. A bit of paper.
bite b . i . t . e . bite. bite means to grip, cut off, or tear with or as if with the teeth
or jaws. A wound resulting from biting by an animal or a person. Gunny invariably tried
to bite her. bitter b . i . t . t . e . r . bitter. bitter
means marked by strong resentment or cynicism. Bitter about the divorce.
bitterly b . i . t . t . e . r . l . y . bitterly. bitterly means in a resentful manner. She
complained bitterly. black b . l . a . c . k . black. black means
total absence of light. Being of the achromatic color of maximum darkness. In the black of
night. Black leather jackets. blade b . l . a . d . e . blade. blade means
especially a leaf of grass or the broad portion of a leaf as distinct from the petiole. The
blades of a propeller. blame b . l . a . m . e . blame. blame means
put or pin the blame on. An accusation that you are responsible for some lapse or misdeed.
The police laid the blame on the driver. blank b . l . a . n . k . blank. blank means
not written or printed on. A blank character used to separate successive words in writing
or printing. Fill in the blank spaces. He said the space is the most important character
in the alphabet. blankly b . l . a . n . k . l . y . blankly.
blankly means in a blank manner. She stared at him blankly.
blind b . l . i . n . d . blind. blind means unable to see. Doctors think he will go blind.
block b . l . o . c . k . block. block means a solid piece of something. Render unsuitable
for passage. The pyramids were built with large stone blocks. Block the way.
blonde b . l . o . n . d . e . blonde. blonde means a person with fair skin and hair. Being
or having light colored skin and hair and usually blue or grey eyes. A house full of
blonde children. blood b . l . o . o . d . blood. blood means
the fluid that is pumped by the heart. Blood carries oxygen and nutrients to the tissues
and carries waste products away. blow b . l . o . w . blow. blow means be blowing
or storming. A powerful stroke with the fist or a weapon. The wind blew from the West.
A blow on the head. blue b . l . u . e . blue. blue means of the
color intermediate between green and violet. Blue color or pigment. Blue haze of tobacco
smoke. He had eyes of bright blue. board b . o . a . r . d . board. board means
a flat piece of material designed for a special purpose. Get on board of trains, buses, etc.he
nailed boards across the windows. on board on board. on board means carried
on a ship, car, etc.an on-board computer. boat b . o . a . t . boat. boat means a small
vessel for travel on water. You can take a boat trip along the coast.
body b . o . d . y . body. body means the entire structure of an organism. He felt as
if his whole body were on fire. boil b . o . i . l . boil. boil means come
to the boiling point and change from a liquid to vapor. Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.
bomb b . o . m . b . bomb. bomb means an explosive device fused to explode under specific conditions.
Throw bombs at or attack with bombs. The Americans bombed Dresden.
bond b . o . n . d . bond. bond means a connection based on kinship or marriage or common interest.
Their friendship constitutes a powerful bond between them.
bone b . o . n . e . bone. bone means rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton
of vertebrates. He survived the accident with no broken bones.
book b . o . o . k . book. book means a written work or composition that has been published.
I am reading a good book on economics. boot b . o . o . t . boot. boot means foot
wear that covers the whole foot and lower leg. A pair of black leather boots.
border b . o . r . d . e . r . border. border means a line that indicates a boundary. A
national park on the border between Kenya and Tanzania.
bore b . o . r . e . bore. bore means cause to be bored. I am not boring you.
boring b . o . r . i . n . g . boring. boring means so lacking in interest as to cause mental
weariness. A boring evening with uninteresting people.
bored b . o . r . e . d . bored. bored means tired of the world. Bored with life.
born b . o . r . n . born. born means come into existence through birth. She was born
on a farm. borrow b . o . r . r . o . w . borrow. borrow
means get temporarily. May I borrow your lawn mower?
boss b . o . s . s . boss. boss means a person who exercises control over workers. If you
want to leave early you have to ask the boss. both b . o . t . h . both. both means two
considered together. Both girls are pretty. bother b . o . t . h . e . r . bother. bother
means take the trouble to do something. He did not bother to call his mother on her birthday.
bottle b . o . t . t . l . e . bottle. bottle means a glass or plastic vessel used for storing
drinks or other liquids. We drank a whole bottle of water.
bottom b . o . t . t . o . m . bottom. bottom means the lower side of anything. Situated
at the bottom or lowest position. The bottom drawer.
bound b . o . u . n . d . bound. bound means secured with a cover or binding. Leather-bound
volumes. bowl b . o . w . l . bowl. bowl means a round
vessel that is open at the top. Fill the bowl with water.
box b . o . x . box. box means a container; may have a lid. He rummaged through a box
of spare parts. boy b . o . y . boy. boy means a youthful
male person. She made the boy brush his teeth every night.
boyfriend b . o . y . f . r . i . e . n . d . boyfriend. boyfriend means a man who is
the lover of a girl or young woman. If I'd known he was her boyfriend I wouldn't have
asked. brain b . r . a . i . n . brain. brain means
that part of the central nervous system that includes all the higher nervous centers. He's
got plenty of brains but no common sense. branch b . r . a . n . c . h . branch. branch
means an administrative division of some larger or more complex organization. A branch of
Congress. brand b . r . a . n . d . brand. brand means
a name given to a product or service. There's a new brand of hero in the movies now.
brave b . r . a . v . e . brave. brave means possessing or displaying courage. Her brave
fight against cancer. bread b . r . e . a . d . bread. bread means
food made from dough of flour or meal and usually raised with yeast or baking powder
and then baked. Would you like some bread with your soup?
break b . r . e . a . k . break. break means terminate. Some abrupt occurrence that interrupts
an ongoing activity. Break the cycle of poverty. there was a break in the action when a player
was hurt. broken b . r . o . k . e . n . broken. broken
means physically and forcibly separated into pieces or cracked or split. His neck is broken.
breakfast b . r . e . a . k . f . a . s . t . breakfast. breakfast means the first meal
of the day. We have breakfast at seven. breast b . r . e . a . s . t . breast. breast
means the front part of the trunk from the neck to the abdomen. He beat his breast in
anger. breath b . r . e . a . t . h . breath. breath
means the process of taking in and expelling air during breathing. He took a deep breath
and dived into the pool. breathe b . r . e . a . t . h . e . breathe.
breathe means draw air into, and expel out of. I can breathe better when the air is clean.
breathing b . r . e . a . t . h . i . n . g . breathing. breathing means the process of
taking in oxygen from inhaled air and releasing carbon dioxide by exhalation. His breathing
was deep and regular. breed b . r . e . e . d . breed. breed means
cause to procreate. A special variety of domesticated animals within a species. She breeds dogs.
brick b . r . i . c . k . brick. brick means rectangular block of clay baked by the sun
or in a kiln. A brick wall. bridge b . r . i . d . g . e . bridge. bridge
means a structure that allows people or vehicles to cross an obstacle such as a river or canal
or railway. We crossed the bridge over the river.
brief b . r . i . e . f . brief. brief means of short duration or distance. A brief stay
in the country. briefly b .
r . i . e . f . l . y . briefly. briefly means for a short time. She visited him briefly.
bright b . r . i . g . h . t . bright. bright means emitting or reflecting light readily
or in large amounts. The sun was bright and hot.
brightly b . r . i . g . h . t . l . y . brightly. brightly means with brightness. The windows
glowed jewel brightly. brilliant b . r . i . l . l . i . a . n . t
. brilliant. brilliant means having or marked by unusual and impressive intelligence. A
brilliant solution to the problem. bring b . r . i . n . g . bring. bring means
take something or somebody with oneself somewhere. Bring me the box from the other room.
broad b . r . o . a . d . broad. broad means having great extent from one side to the other.
A river two miles broad. broadly b . r . o . a . d . l . y . broadly.
broadly means without regard to specific details or exceptions. He interprets the law broadly.
broadcast b . r . o . a . d . c . a . s . t . broadcast. broadcast means broadcast over
the airwaves, as in radio or television. A radio or television show. We cannot broadcast
this X-rated song. Did you see his broadcast last night?
broken b . r . o . k . e . n . broken. broken means physically and forcibly separated into
pieces or cracked or split. A broken mirror. brother b . r . o . t . h . e . r . brother.
brother means a male with the same parents as someone else. My brother still lives with
our parents. brown b . r . o . w . n . brown. brown means
of a color similar to that of wood or earth. of a color similar to that of wood or earth.
He has a beautiful brown hair. Leaves of various shades of brown.
brush b . r . u . s . h . brush. brush means rub with a brush, or as if with a brush. An
implement that has hairs or bristles firmly set into a handle. Johnson brushed the hairs
from his jacket. bubble b . u . b . b . l . e . bubble. bubble
means a hollow globule of gas. A bubble of oxygen.
budget b . u . d . g . e . t . budget. budget means a sum of money allocated for a particular
purpose. The laboratory runs on a budget of a million a year.
build b . u . i . l . d . build. build means make by combining materials and parts. Some
eccentric built an electric brassiere warmer. building b . u . i . l . d . i . n . g . building.
building means a structure that has a roof and walls and stands more or less permanently
in one place. There was a three-story building on the corner.
bullet b . u . l . l . e . t . bullet. bullet means a projectile that is fired from a gun.
A bullet wound in the shoulder. bunch b . u . n . c . h . bunch. bunch means
a grouping of a number of similar things. A bunch of trees.
burn b . u . r . n . burn. burn means destroy by fire. They burned the house and his diaries.
burst b . u . r . s . t . burst. burst means break open or apart suddenly. The bubble burst.
bury b . u . r . y . bury. bury means cover from sight. Afghani women buried under their
burkas. bus b . u . s . bus. bus means a vehicle carrying
many passengers. He always rode the bus to work.
bush b . u . s . h . bush. bush means a low woody perennial plant usually having several
major branches. A rose bush. business b . u . s . i . n . e . s . s . business.
business means a commercial or industrial enterprise and the people who constitute it.
He bought his brother's business. businessman b . u . s . i . n . e . s . s
. m . a . n . businessman. businessman means a person engaged in commercial or industrial
business. He is an intelligent businessman. businesswoman b . u . s . i . n . e . s . s
. w . o . m . a . n businesswoman. businesswoman means a female businessperson. She has a reputation
for being a very shrewd businesswoman. busy b . u . s . y . busy. busy means actively
or fully engaged or occupied. He is very busy with her work.
but b . u . t . but. but means and nothing more. Hopes that last but a moment.
butter b . u . t . t . e . r . butter. butter means an edible emulsion of fat globules made
by churning milk or cream. Do you want butter or margarine on your toast?
butt b . u . t . t . butt. butt means thick end of the handle. A rifle butt.
button b . u . t . t . o . n . button. button means a round fastener sewn to shirts and
coats etc to fit through buttonholes. A button was missing from his shirt.
buy b . u . y . buy. buy means obtain by purchase. The family buy a new car.
buyer b . u . y . e . r . buyer. buyer meansÂ a person who buys. There were several potential
buyers. by b . y . by. by means at the side of someone
or something. The telephone is by the window bye b . y . e . bye. bye means a farewell
remark. They said their good-byes. Thanks for watching! This is all for section
2, go on to section 3 of this program if you need to. We will see you next time. Goodbye!
